Content:: Hypogeusia is a reduced ability to taste things (to taste sweet, sour, bitter, or salty substances). The complete lack of taste is referred to as ageusia. Causes of hypogeusia include the chemotherapy drug bleomycin,[1] an antitumor antibiotic, Bell's Palsy, and zinc deficiency among others.[2][3][4][5]  This medical symptom article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
